pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.1: “About the second undetermined offense that was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One—here was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.6: Udāyī sitting alone with a woman in private.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.7: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.9: There is no addition to the rule. There is no unprompted rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.10: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere, or that applies in a particular place?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.12: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common, or a rule they do not have in common?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.13: A rule they do not have in common.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.14: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both Sanghas?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.16: “In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it immersed and included?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.20: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.21: It may be failure in morality or failure in conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.22: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.23: It may be in the class of offenses entailing suspension, or in the class of offenses entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.24: “Through how many of the six kinds of origins of offenses does it originate?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.26: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.27: from speech and mind, not from body; or
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.29: “To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.30: Legal issues arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.31: “Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.33: it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …
